description: Papayas are tropical fruits with a soft, orange flesh and a large central cavity filled with black seeds. They have a sweet, musky flavor and are known for their high vitamin C content and digestive enzymes.

flavor_profile.notes: Sweet and musky with tropical flavor

storage_tips: Store unripe papayas at room temperature until slightly soft to touch. Once ripe, refrigerate for up to 3 days. The flesh can be frozen for longer storage. Handle gently as they bruise easily.
preparation: Cut the fruit in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds. The seeds are edible but have a peppery flavor. For jams, use the flesh and discard the seeds. The soft texture makes excellent smooth jams.
